name: California
title: The government was once a steady partner for nonprofits. That's changing
description: In his second term, President Donald Trump has cut a huge range of federal grants that fund social services. The cuts are disrupting the decades-long partnerships between the government and nonprofits. An Urban Institute analysis shows the scale and breadth of that relationship. In 2021, nonprofits received $267 billion in grants from all levels of government grants. More than half of nonprofits would face budget deficits without this funding. Nonprofits across the U.S. are struggling to adapt, with some forced to restructure or reduce services. Leaders warn that private donations cannot replace the scale of government support.
